message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper deals with natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques for offensive language detection on social media data. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. The paper also employs transfer learning techniques, which are commonly used in machine learning and deep learning, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) another likely sub-category. The use of neural networks and deep learning models also suggests cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a possible sub-category. The paper also involves topic modeling using Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA), which falls under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it deals with social media data and its impact on society.
